TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

That's popping up for me too, want to meet up at 47,8 sometime? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
Are mods not accepting PM's at this time? Fallout from hosting move? (I haven't tried in ~6 months.) I got "\_\_\_\_ cannot receive messages."

> 
> 
> Are mods not accepting PM's at this time? Fallout from hosting move? (I haven't tried in ~6 months.) I got "\_\_\_\_ cannot receive messages."

I'm not aware of any trouble. Who were you trying to message? I don't mean to be nosey, but he could check his inbox if you're willing to say.

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, Vanamonde said:
> 
> 
> I'm not aware of any trouble. Who were you trying to message? I don't mean to be nosey, but he could check his inbox if you're willing to say.
> 

You've got mail! it was not sending when I wrote the question above. Tried 2-3 times, to two different moderators. Started to think it might be a browser issue, but, it "sent" when I tried it just now.
I got yours, replied, and included the original target person. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

What happens when a report is filed? Is there some kind of tab thing for mods that say who's reported what (Kind of like the notifications tab)?

\*looks up\*

Oh my god, vanamonde has 11,000 posts... jaysus

When somebody reports a post, we moderators get something like the PM notifications you guys get. The reports go into a queue of stuff waiting to be addressed, which is also somewhat similar to your PM inboxes. 

(And there are several people who have way more posts than I have.)

***Entirely Hypothetical Question:***

If the forum were to be struck by viral attackers that would damage the forums, or otherwise damage its users (like myself), what would the moderation/technical teams response be? 

-and no, I’m not curious so I can try, I’ve just been watching some videos on malicious data attacks and can’t help but wonder what safe guards a good community might have.

So I couldn't help but notice that since the migration, the forums are *a lot* slower and *significantly* buggier.  I had to hard refresh a few times just to get the ability to post this back.

I can no longer post from the desktop version at all. Not allowed to click on text field. This is from my phone. 

Can anyone else on a Mac post?

i have no text field to click into anymore.
Forum works on the Mac in Chrome, but not Firefox (my usual browser), or Safari (which I don't really use).
Hmm. I'm on Windows/Chrome/PC/desktop and have been posting all day. No problems.
I am on Win10 Firefox, and I've not encountered any problems.

I was using Firefox until a couple hours ago, then it utterly stopped working with this forum. I restarted the machine, and tried 3 browsers, and only Chrome now works (all used to work).

I changed nothing at all, the same forum window that had been open suddenly no longer worked. Flash, etc is up to date.

Mac.

Just tried another, older Mac. Doesn't work with Safari.
Update your browsers and your computer if you haven't already.

The browsers are all current. My OS is not (Yosemite). If my OS was current (High Sierra), then the KSP forum would not matter to me, since KSP doesn't like the current Mac OS, apparently.

Sounds like a job for...

Is it a bird? a plane? No, it's [@ManeTI](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167672-maneti/)!

![giphy.gif](https://i.giphy.com/media/10bKPDUM5H7m7u/giphy.gif)

Quick question:

I've made a mod that changes Kerbals names, using US Census data (popular names in the US).

Before I release it I need to check this. One of the names it's generated is a word that means "female genitalia" here in the UK, although it's an acceptable name in the US. It's not a *bad* word per se, it's used as a "kiddy-ism" for that area of the body, but it's skating a bit close to 2.2c so I want to check,

(the word is spoilered just in case I run foul of 2.2c, please remove if it still runs afoul of that rule)

Spoiler

The word is "Fanny" - I've also noticed "Willie" which with a slight change of spelling would be the equivalent male part of the body in UK colloquialism

Can I get away with a release on the basis that it's just a cultural difference, or do I really need to go and vet all 7000 odd names?

**Edited <time datetime="2018-03-07T10:40:42Z" title="03/07/2018 10:40  AM" data-short="6 yr">March 7, 2018</time> by severedsolo**

[@severedsolo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/80345-severedsolo/) with names like that, context is everything. Fanny Kerman as a name in an innocent setting should be absolutely fine. But if someone starts making dirty jokes about them, that will be absolutely not OK.

> 
> 
> Just now, Deddly said:
> 
> 
> [@severedsolo](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/80345-severedsolo/) with names like that, context is everything. Fanny Kerman as a name in an innocent setting should be absolutely fine. But if someone starts making dirty jokes about them, that will be absolutely not OK.
> 

Thanks for the clarification. If it becomes a problem I will of course remove them, I just don't really fancy going through 7000 lines worth of names.
